page.title: 04Traditions-Medbourne,Drayton
page.content: The area is traditionally a fox hunting country with certain hedges, fences, fields and copses maintained to facilitate the passage of hounds and huntsmen and provide cover for the foxes. The Fernie Hunt meet regularly in the area during the winter and the Westerby Bassett meet to hunt the hare. Medbourne maintains it's customary summer church fete and a party is held every Christmas time for the children of Drayton Parish at their village hall. This topic would not be complete without a mention of the 'Bottle Kicking' which dates back at least 500 years.This takes place in the fields between Medbourne and Hallaton with combatants from the two villages, plus helpers, scrambling to carry a small keg of ale over their own boundary line, usually emboldened by a considerable consumption of ale.
